intro: Cucumis agrestis subsp. figari, commonly known as the wild cucumber or figari cucumber, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other cucurbits like cucumbers and melons. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with hairy, lobed leaves and yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, elongated, spiny cucumber that matures to a pale green color. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
